name: Eucharistic Miracle of Buenos Aires

location.address: Parish of Santa María, Buenos Aires

description: A consecrated Host transformed into living human heart tissue and blood following proper Eucharistic handling.
narrative: Between 1992 and 1996, three Eucharistic miracles occurred at the parish of Santa María in Buenos Aires. The investigation was overseen by the future Pope Francis.
scientificEvidence: Forensic pathology, histology, and DNA testing identified the substance as living human cardiac muscle tissue.
significance: The miracle strongly supports Catholic teaching on the Real Presence of Christ in the Eucharist.

name: Miracle of Lanciano
description: The oldest and most famous Eucharistic miracle, where the consecrated host turned into flesh and wine into blood during Mass.
narrative: A Basilian monk doubting the Real Presence witnessed the bread and wine transform into actual flesh and blood during Mass.
scientificEvidence: Scientific analysis in 1970-1971 confirmed the flesh is cardiac tissue and the blood is human blood type AB.
significance: One of the most scientifically documented Eucharistic miracles in Church history.

name: Miracle of Amsterdam
description: The Host remained intact after being thrown into fire, leading to centuries of devotion in Amsterdam.
narrative: A dying man vomited the consecrated Host. It was thrown into the fire but remained unconsumed.
scientificEvidence: Historical documentation and centuries of continuous devotion.
significance: Led to the Silent Procession tradition that continues today in Amsterdam.

name: Miracle of Sokółka
description: A consecrated Host that fell on the floor developed a red stain identified as heart muscle tissue.
narrative: During distribution of Communion, a Host fell and was placed in water. Days later, a red stain appeared.
scientificEvidence: Forensic analysis confirmed the presence of human heart muscle tissue.
significance: One of the most recent scientifically documented Eucharistic miracles.

name: Miracle of Legnica
description: A consecrated Host dropped during Christmas Mass showed signs of human heart tissue.
narrative: During Christmas Mass, a Host fell and was placed in water. Red fibers appeared within days.
scientificEvidence: Forensic pathology confirmed the presence of fragmented human heart muscle tissue.
significance: Recent miracle that strengthens faith in the Real Presence.

name: Miracle of Tumaco
description: The consecrated Host remained intact and luminous after a devastating earthquake and tsunami.
narrative: During a massive earthquake and tsunami, the church was destroyed but the monstrance with the Host remained intact and glowing.
significance: Demonstrates God's protection and presence even in natural disasters.

name: Miracle of Siena
description: Consecrated Hosts stolen in 1730 remain perfectly intact and fresh to this day.
narrative: 223 consecrated Hosts were stolen but later recovered. Despite no preservatives, they remain fresh after nearly 300 years.
scientificEvidence: Multiple scientific examinations confirm the Hosts show no signs of decay or corruption.
significance: One of the longest-lasting Eucharistic miracles, defying natural decomposition.

name: Miracle of Tixtla

location.address: Parish of St. Martin of Tours, Tixtla

description: A consecrated Host began bleeding during adoration, later confirmed to be human blood.
narrative: During a prayer service, a Host in the chalice began to bleed. Scientific analysis confirmed it was human blood.
scientificEvidence: Laboratory testing identified the presence of human blood type AB.
significance: Recent miracle that provides modern scientific evidence of the Real Presence.

name: Miracle of Betania
description: During Mass, a consecrated Host began to bleed in the presence of multiple witnesses.
narrative: Father Otty Ossa Aristizábal witnessed the Host bleeding during Mass. Multiple people saw the phenomenon.
scientificEvidence: Eyewitness testimony from numerous faithful present at the Mass.
significance: Occurred at a site of approved Marian apparitions, connecting Eucharistic and Marian devotion.

name: Miracle of Chirattakonam
description: A consecrated Host was seen bleeding during Mass, witnessed by hundreds of faithful.
narrative: During the Good Friday service, the Host began bleeding. The phenomenon was witnessed by the entire congregation.
scientificEvidence: Eyewitness accounts from hundreds of people present at the service.
significance: Rare Eucharistic miracle in India, strengthening faith in a region with Hindu majority.

name: Miracle of Bordeaux
description: Consecrated Hosts survived a devastating fire that destroyed the church building.
narrative: A massive fire destroyed the church, but the ciborium containing the Hosts was found intact and the Hosts perfectly preserved.
scientificEvidence: Historical documentation of the fire and the miraculous preservation.
significance: Divine protection of the Blessed Sacrament even in catastrophic circumstances.
